description: From Middle English filial, from Latin fīliālis, from filius (“son”) / filia (“daughter”).

adjectives.description: filial (comparative more filial, superlative most filial)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) Pertaining to or befitting a son or daughter.
examples: Coordinate terms: motherly, maternal, parental, fatherly, paternal

entries.meaning: (comparable) Respectful of the duties and attitudes of sons or daughters toward their parents.
(genetics) Of a generation or generations descending from a specific previous one.
